id: Note that hasBestMeasure and hasWorstMeasure may be used together to determine the direction and range of a scale's measure values.
name: Note that hasBestMeasure and hasWorstMeasure may be used together to determine the direction and range of a scale's measure values.

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address hygiene issues with respect to text formatting.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address hygiene issues with respect to text formatting.

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace hasDefinition with isDefinedIn to clarify intent.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace hasDefinition with isDefinedIn to clarify intent.

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace uses of hasTag in Relations with hasTag from LCC, as the more complex union of datatypes in the Relations concept is not needed here.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace uses of hasTag in Relations with hasTag from LCC, as the more complex union of datatypes in the Relations concept is not needed here.

id: rating performer an issuer uses to assess ratings
name: rating performer an issuer uses to assess ratings

id: Ratings.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Ratings.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: party that is responsible for issuing ratings
name: party that is responsible for issuing ratings

id: indicates a relative, numeric measure or ordering on a rating scale
name: indicates a relative, numeric measure or ordering on a rating scale

id: assessment activity resulting in a grade or score and potentially a report describing the score and the process used to determine that score
name: assessment activity resulting in a grade or score and potentially a report describing the score and the process used to determine that score

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate duplication with LCC.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate duplication with LCC.

id: A rating issuer is frequently, but not always the rating scale publisher. A rating issuer may delegate responsibility for producing a rating to a rating party.
name: A rating issuer is frequently, but not always the rating scale publisher. A rating issuer may delegate responsibility for producing a rating to a rating party.

id: system for assigning a value to something according to some scale with respect to quality, a standard, or ranking
name: system for assigning a value to something according to some scale with respect to quality, a standard, or ranking

id: Rating scale publishers are frequently also rating agencies.
name: Rating scale publishers are frequently also rating agencies.

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add properties indicating the 'best' and 'worst' scores on a given scale.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add properties indicating the 'best' and 'worst' scores on a given scale.

id: standing of something at a particular time, indicated by at least one scores with respect to some scale, based on an assessment by some party
name: standing of something at a particular time, indicated by at least one scores with respect to some scale, based on an assessment by some party

id: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate circular definitions.
name: Ratings.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate circular definitions.

id: indicates the instrument, party or something else to which a rating applies
name: indicates the instrument, party or something else to which a rating applies

id: Ratings.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace an additional property with its equivalent in the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FBC-322).
name: Ratings.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace an additional property with its equivalent in the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FBC-322).

id: rating score that is a simple numeric value on some scale, such as a credit rating for an individual
name: rating score that is a simple numeric value on some scale, such as a credit rating for an individual

id: rating issuer that is also a rating scale publisher, frequently but not always an independent rating service
name: rating issuer that is also a rating scale publisher, frequently but not always an independent rating service

id: indicates the rating assigned to a thing based on a grade or score according to a particular rating scale
name: indicates the rating assigned to a thing based on a grade or score according to a particular rating scale

id: person, organization or group that analyzes some aspect of something and develops a rating
name: person, organization or group that analyzes some aspect of something and develops a rating

id: indicates the 'worst' (least desirable) possible value for a rating score's hasMeasureWithinScale property
name: indicates the 'worst' (least desirable) possible value for a rating score's hasMeasureWithinScale property

id: Ratings for the creditworthiness of securities are often qualitative, rather than quantitative, such as a triple-A (i.e., AAA). Many ratings for products and businesses on the Internet are also qualitative, such as 5-star ratings for something.
name: Ratings for the creditworthiness of securities are often qualitative, rather than quantitative, such as a triple-A (i.e., AAA). Many ratings for products and businesses on the Internet are also qualitative, such as 5-star ratings for something.

id: Ratings.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Ratings.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: The meaning and methodology for determining a rating score for the rating of something is determined by a rating issuer. A given rating may apply at some point in time, as a part of a lifecycle or process, or generally. Typically ratings reflect an assessment of a state of affairs at some point in time.
name: The meaning and methodology for determining a rating score for the rating of something is determined by a rating issuer. A given rating may apply at some point in time, as a part of a lifecycle or process, or generally. Typically ratings reflect an assessment of a state of affairs at some point in time.

id: individual assessment resulting in a grade or score and potentially a report describing the score
name: individual assessment resulting in a grade or score and potentially a report describing the score

id: report describing a set of ratings
name: report describing a set of ratings

id: rating score that is represented as a qualitative code with respect to some rating scale
name: rating score that is represented as a qualitative code with respect to some rating scale

id: indicates the 'best' (most desirable) possible value for a rating score's hasMeasureWithinScale property
name: indicates the 'best' (most desirable) possible value for a rating score's hasMeasureWithinScale property

id: This ontology defines abstract concepts for representation of ratings and rating schemes, particularly for ratings describing aspects of business performance, credit worthiness, and investment quality at a high level.
name: This ontology defines abstract concepts for representation of ratings and rating schemes, particularly for ratings describing aspects of business performance, credit worthiness, and investment quality at a high level.

id: indicates the grade or score associated with a rating with respect to a particular rating scale
name: indicates the grade or score associated with a rating with respect to a particular rating scale

id: grade, classification, or ranking of for something in accordance with some rating scale
name: grade, classification, or ranking of for something in accordance with some rating scale

id: issuer for which ratings are produced or posted through
name: issuer for which ratings are produced or posted through

id: party responsible for managing one or more rating schemes and potentially publishing ratings based on those schemes
name: party responsible for managing one or more rating schemes and potentially publishing ratings based on those schemes
